meanings.definition: Competed eagerly with someone in order to achieve something.
meanings.sent1: The students vied for the top spot in the spelling bee.
meanings.sent2: The athletes vied for the gold medal in the race.
meanings.sent3: The siblings vied playfully to see who could finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: The flowers vied for attention in the vibrant garden.
meanings.sent5: The candidates vied for the voters' support in the election.

meanings.sent1: The two siblings vied for control of the TV remote.
meanings.sent2: The teams vied for dominance on the basketball court.
meanings.sent3: The puppies vied for the comfiest spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The waves vied for power as they crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The artists vied for recognition in the competitive art world.

meanings.definition: Contended with another for victory or superiority.
meanings.sent1: The chefs vied for the title of the best dessert maker.
meanings.sent2: The companies vied for the largest share of the market.
meanings.sent3: The animals vied for the juiciest fruits on the tree.
meanings.sent4: The clouds vied for space in the vast sky.
meanings.sent5: The students vied for the top grades in the class.
